intro: Gambeya africana, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their vibrant colors and fragrance. Gambeya africana thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
